str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To wear the hair long, allow the hair to grow out. From kome; to wear tresses of hair.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Hair, long hair. Apparently from the same as komizo; the hair of the head.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; opposite, i.e. Instead or because of.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of periballo; something thrown around one, i.e. A mantle, veil.
